page.title: 19Local Landscape S.Yorkshire.
page.content: The{landscape}of our area consists of farmland interspersed with{parkland. Over the area there are lots of interesting buildings giving a wide variety of styles and sizes.There is very little uniformity in the {landscape,}the four{villages}showing both ribbon development and the traditional pattern of a{village around a central point.Hooton Pagnell has first been awarded the Best Kept {Village}Award for the third consecutive year.The planted{parkland has greatly matured to an extent where many trees have fallen down.Many of our largest and most beatiful trees have had to be felled because of Dutch {Elm}disease. This has meant a great change in the{landscape.}We lost one {elm}tree in the school garden that was a feature of our local{landscape.}Many of walls and hedges are derelict.
